intro: Scurrula biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered scurrula, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, hairy leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Scurrula biflora is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
